items.message:
River levels are rising in response to recent heavy rainfall. Flooding is possible this evening, Tuesday 15/07/2025. Areas most at risk include low lying land around Widdale Beck, surrounding the A684.
Rainfall is expected throughout this evening. We are closely monitoring the situation and do not expect to issue any flood warnings at this time.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourse and do not attempt to walk, drive or cycle through flood water. 
Take care and consider activating your flood plan if you have one. This message will be updated by 07:30 AM on Wednesday 16/07/2025, or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels this afternoon may lead to flooding.
Flooding is possible from 3:00 PM on 15/07/2025.
Areas most at risk include Rivers Kent and Bela and other watercourses, from Kentmere to Silverdale including low lying areas around Staveley, Burneside, Kendal, Milnthorpe and Beetham.
Weather conditions are expected to improve throughout the evening.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
This message will be updated by 09:00 AM on 16/07/2025, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message:
Rising river levels throughout the afternoon may lead to flooding.
Flooding is possible from 2:00 PM on 15/07/2025.
Areas most at risk are the rivers around Ambleside with flooding also possible around Rivers Brathay, Rothay and Winster and other watercourses, from Grasmere to Grange-over-Sands including, Skelwith Bridge, Windermere, Hawkshead, Newby Bridge, Backbarrow, Cark and Cartmel.
Weather conditions are expected to improve throughout the evening .
We are closely monitoring the situation and checking rivers for blockages. We will issue flood warnings if required.
Consider activating any property flood protection products. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.
This message will be updated by 09:00 AM on 16/07/2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers in Ambleside, Rydal Road, Kirkfield, Rothay Park, Fisher Beck, The Borrans

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Rothay, Greenbank Drain, Stock Ghyll, Kirkfield Drain, Fisher Beck, Scandale Beck

items.message:
The Flood Warning has now been removed. However, a Flood Alert remains in force for the wider area, so flooding of roads and low lying land is still possible.
Weather conditions are expected to improve this evening and no further flooding is expected.
